info.title: E-Wallet
info.description:
# Introduction

An API collection for an e-wallet app, hosted on [heroku](https://e-wallet-app.herokuapp.com/) All amounts are returned in Naira except stated otherwise.

# Authentication

Authenticated routes require token for access. This token is sent as a cookie (named `w6099912302832`) and in the response body (as `token`) when user logs in, signs up or change password.

# Response Codes

Each response will be returned with one of the following HTTP status codes:

- `200` `OK` The request was successful
- `201` `Created` Successful request, A new resource has been created
- `400` `Bad Request` There was a problem with the user request (e.g: Invalid field values)
- `401` `Unauthorized` The supplied API credentials are invalid
- `404` `Not Found` An attempt was made to access a resource that does not exist in the API
- `500` `Server Error` An error occured on the server.

# Rate Limits

Requests are limited to 150 per hour.

post.description: Signup Route, for registering new users. Requires **email**, **name**, **password** and **passwordConfirm** fields.

text/plain.example: w6099912302832=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6IjRkYjgyZTcyLTI5N2MtNDEzYi1iMzI0LWExZTA1NTI1ZjMzNiIsImlhdCI6MTU5Mzk1NjM2MCwiZXhwIjoxNTk0MjE1NTYwfQ.RoOsFlhtda-T7VLAhXlYd9tulVGmgVFiv69YqiNl4xE; Path=/; Expires=Wed, 08 Jul 2020 13:39:20 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure

post.description: Login Route, for logging in existing users. Requires **email** and **password** fields.

text/plain.example: w6099912302832=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6ImU1MjZhMzkwLWJjNmItNDJmNy1hNjc4LWU4OWVjNTQ3NjlkYyIsImlhdCI6MTU5Mzk2MTEyOCwiZXhwIjoxNTk0MjIwMzI4fQ.vJm0YP950AwGIF7zFhgLwRbsDRWf71YjorZybPygQDk; Path=/; Expires=Wed, 08 Jul 2020 14:58:48 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure

w6099912302832=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6ImU1MjZhMzkwLWJjNmItNDJmNy1hNjc4LWU4OWVjNTQ3NjlkYyIsImlhdCI6MTU5Mzk2MTIzMywiZXhwIjoxNTk0MjIwNDMzfQ.TuMbVkAIPKSIf5yZeA9SfbVQtFheGCSOARLNDio7C2U; Path=/; Expires=Wed, 08 Jul 2020 15:00:33 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure

post.description: Route to transfer money to another user. The ***recipient*** field contains the recipient wallet number and is sent in the request body with ***amount*** - the amount to be transferred (in Naira and to a maximum of 2 decimal places) and ***narration*** - reason for the transfer. All fields are required. Users can not transfer above their current account balance.

get.description:
Get a user's transaction history. It returns both debit and credit transactions by default. Requires authentication. Response can be formatted in the following manners:

- Use request queries to filter transactions based on their type (debit/credit) or status (success, pending or failed);

- You can also sort transactions by date or amount. Default sort order is ascending, add a negative (-) sign to your sort query to sort in descending order

| Sign | Format |
| ------ | ------ |
| Sort in desc order by amount | `url?sort=-date` |
| get pending transactions | `url?status=pending` |

- Results can be paginated using the **page** and **limit** request query parameters.

For example, to get the second page of a response limited to 3 per request:
`url?page=2&limit=3`
Get a single transaction through its id. Requires authentication

post.description: - Route to fund wallet using Paystack. Requires authentication - users can only fund their own wallet. The request body should contain the amount to fund the wallet with (in Naira and to a maximum of 2 decimal places). It returns an authorization url which the user will visit to complete their transaction, else transaction will remain pending. (Note that the Paystack channel is in test mode, hence only the provided test channels can be used).

get.description: Get a user's available balance. Requires authentication
- Paystack route to verify payment. Requests to this route are made from Paystack to confirm a payment has been made and to determine if it was successful or not

tags.name: Auth
tags.description: The authentication route, It includes routes to signup, login and change pasword routes

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Route for transactions between users. Users can transfer and get their transactions history.

tags.name: Wallet
tags.description: Route for Wallet operations including funding and getting wallet balance
